answers.answer: Hi there!Recurrent staphylococcal infections are common in people with eczema, seborrhea, weak immune system, diabetes mellitius, obesity etc.Auto infection by nose picking and scratching is common in staphylococcal infections. Itch scratch itch cycle leads to recurrent infection. What type of  cyst is this? You should get all your doubts clarified with your doctor. Do write to us again with more details about this cyst. I do hope it helps.Take care and regards!

question: I have had a staph infection reoccur on my chin four times.  I have been cut, packed, and sent off with antibiotics and pain pills three times, needless to say I went straight to the doctor the fourth time and that was today.  He gave me not just one but two antibiotics along with an ointment to put in my nose four times a day.  He also agreed with me that I need to see a dermatologist.  He thinks I may have a cyst that is causing the infection to reoccur.  Is this possible?  Today was the fourth re-occurance in the same spot and the same thing, the one prior to this was not even two months ago....why is this and if determined as a cyst, what happens next?
title: staph infections on the chin
